title: High Carbon Dioxide Damage Impact
description: In 2020, carbon dioxide damage accounted for 9.85% of Syria's GNI, indicating significant environmental challenges.

title: Low Political Stability
description: Syria's political stability estimate in 2023 was -2.75, reflecting ongoing challenges with violence and terrorism.

title: High Pupil-Teacher Ratio in Tertiary Education
description: In 2015, Syria had a pupil-teacher ratio of 64.41 in tertiary education, indicating potential challenges in educational quality.

title: Significant Merchandise Exports to MENA Region
description: In 2023, 58.07% of Syria's merchandise exports were directed to low- and middle-income economies in the Middle East & North Africa.

title: Low Control of Corruption
description: In 2023, Syria's control of corruption percentile rank was 0.47, indicating significant governance challenges.

title: Minimal Mineral Depletion Impact
description: In 2018, mineral depletion accounted for a negligible 0.00000178% of Syria's GNI, suggesting sustainable resource use.

title: High Dependency on UNRWA Flows
description: In 2022, Syria received $50.6 million in net official flows from UNRWA, highlighting reliance on international aid.

title: Minimal Debt Service Burden
description: In 2020, public and publicly guaranteed debt service was only 0.00002% of Syria's GNI, indicating a low debt burden.

title: Negative Government Consumption Growth
description: In 2022, Syria experienced a -49.42% growth in general government final consumption expenditure, reflecting economic contraction.
